Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『スールズの夕べ』 二十年以上前、村を訪れた画家を 無理やり泊め、描かせた作品。 この家の絵はすべて同様にして 手に入れた作品ばかり。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>"Sulz in the Evening" Some twenty years ago, a painter who had been forced to stay in Sulz painted this piece. All the paintings in this building were obtained in a similar manner.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『各地の宿屋情報』 他の街や村にある宿屋の紹介。 何年も前に貼ったものなので、 宿賃などが変わっている可能性大。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>"Information on Various Inns" A flyer with information about inns in other villages on it. It's been a few years since it was posted, so the room fees and such listed are likely out of date.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『ポプラのパイパーティ・ポスター』 スールズで定期的に行われている ポプラおばさんが作るパイを 村人みんなで食べるパーティ。 このポスターは去年のもの。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>"Poplar's Peach Pie Party Poster" A party held periodically in Sulz where Ms. Poplar makes peach pies for everyone to eat. This poster is from last year's.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『壁の絵』 二十年以上前、強引にここに 泊めさせられ、何枚もの絵を 描かされた旅の画家が、住人の 目を盗んで描いた花の絵。 花言葉「強欲」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00> "Mural" Over twenty years ago, when forced to stay here, an artist on a journey to create various pieces painted these flowers while the innkeepers weren't looking. In the language of flowers, these blossoms represent "Greed".
Hmph... What do you need from me...

Entry.JapaneseText: ポプラおばさんの…… パイ……ねえ……
行きたいけど…… どうしようかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd like to go, but... Oh, what should I do...
